unit.name: Tyrant
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry (character), Base Size: 40 x 40 mm, Unit Size: 1, Equipment: Hand weapon and light armour, Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Bull Charge, Fear, Impact Hits (2), Ogre Charge

unit.name: Bruiser
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry (character), Base Size: 40 x 40 mm, Unit Size: 1, Equipment: Hand weapon and light armour, Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Bull Charge, Fear, Impact Hits (2), Ogre Charge

unit.name: Battle Standard Bearer
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry (character), Base Size: 40 x 40 mm, Unit Size: 1, Battle Standard Bearer, Equipment: Hand weapon and light armour, Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Bull Charge, Fear, Impact Hits (2), Ogre Charge

unit.name: Slaughtermaster
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry (character), Base Size: 40 x 40 mm (50 x 100 mm with Butchers Cauldron), Unit Size: 1, Equipment: Hand weapon, Wizard, Magic: A Slaughtermaster is a Level 3 Wizard, Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Fear, Impact Hits (2), Lore of the Great Maw, Ogre Charge

unit.name: Butcher
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry (character), Base Size: 40 x 40 mm (50 x 100 mm with Butchers Cauldron), Unit Size: 1, Equipment: Hand weapon, Wizard, Magic: A Butcher is a Level 1 Wizard, Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Fear, Impact Hits (2), Lore of the Great Maw, Ogre Charge

unit.name: Hunter
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry (character), Base Size: 50 x 50 mm, Unit Size: 1, Equipment: Hand weapon, great throwing spears (see below) and light armour, Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Fear, Impact Hits (1), Loner, Move Through Cover, Ogre Charge, Running with the Pack

unit.name: Firebelly
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry (character), Base Size: 40 x 40 mm, Unit Size: 1, Equipment: Hand weapon and flaming breath (see below), Wizard, Magic: A Firebelly is a Level 1 Wizard, Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Blessings of the Volcano God, Fear, Flaming Attacks, Impact Hits (1), Ogre Charge

unit.name: Ogre Bulls
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry, Base Size: 40 x 40 mm, Unit Size: 3+, OgreBulls, Equipment: Hand weapons and light armour, Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Close Order, Fear, Impact Hits (1), Ogre Charge

unit.name: Ironguts
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry, Base Size: 40 x 40 mm, Unit Size: 3+, Equipment: Hand weapons, great weapons and heavy armour, Special Rules: Close Order, Fear, Impact Hits (1), Ogre Charge

unit.name: Gnoblar Trappers
unit.description: Troop Type: Regular infantry, Base Size: 25 x 25 mm, Unit Size: 10+, Equipment: Sharp stuff (counts as hand weapons and throwing weapons), Special Rules: Largely Insignificant, Move through Cover, Scouts, Skirmishers, Traps & Snares

unit.name: Gnoblar Fighters
unit.description: Troop Type: Regular infantry, Base Size: 25 x 25 mm, Unit Size: 20+, Equipment: Sharp stuff (counts as hand weapons and throwing weapons), Special Rules: Close Order, Horde, Largely Insignificant

unit.name: Sabretusk Packs
unit.description: Troop Type: War beasts, Base Size: 25 x 50 mm, Unit Size: 2-10, Equipment: Claws and fangs (counts as hand weapons), Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Fear, Impetuous, Loner, Move Through Cover, Open Order, Skirmishers, Swiftstride

unit.name: Leadbelchers
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry, Base Size: 40 x 40 mm, Unit Size: 2+, Equipment: Hand weapons, leadbelcher guns (see below) and light armour, Special Rules: Close Order, Fear, Impact Hits (1), Ogre Charge

unit.name: Maneaters
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry, Base Size: 40 x 40 mm, Unit Size: 2+, Equipment: Hand weapons and light armour, Special Rules: Close Order, Fear, Impact Hits (1), Motley Crew, Ogre Charge

unit.name: Yhetees
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry, Base Size: 40 x 40 mm, Unit Size: 3+, Equipment: Grimfrost weapons, Special Rules: Armoured Hide (1), Fear, Flammable, Loner, Move through Cover, Numbing Chill, Open Order, Swiftstride

unit.name: Yhetees (Scout/Vanguard)
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous infantry, Base Size: 40 x 40 mm, Unit Size: 3+, Equipment: Grimfrost weapons, Special Rules: Armoured Hide (1), Fear, Flammable, Loner, Move through Cover, Numbing Chill, Open Order, Swiftstride

unit.name: Mournfang Cavalry
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous cavalry, Base Size: 50 x 100 mm, Unit Size: 2+, Equipment: Ogre: Hand weapons and light armour, Mournfang: Monstrous tusks (see below), Special Rules: Armoured Hide (1), Close Order, Fear, Impact Hits (D3), Mournfang Charge, Swiftstride

unit.name: Ironblaster
unit.description: Troop Type: Heavy Chariot, Base Size: 60 x 100 mm, Unit Size: 1, Armour Value: 4+, Equipment: Ironblaster: Cannon of the Sky-titans (see below), Leadbelcher: Hand weapon, Gnoblar Scrapper: Sharp stuff (counts as a hand weapon and throwing weapons), Rhinox:Tusks and horns (counts as a hand weapon), Special Rules: Armour Bane (2, Rhinox only), Close Order, Fear, First Charge, Impact Hits (D6+1), Large Target

unit.name: Gnoblar Scraplauncher
unit.description: Troop Type: Heavy Chariot, Base Size: 60 x 100 mm, Unit Size: 1, Armour Value: 4+, Equipment: Scraplauncher: Scraplauncher catapult (see below), Gnoblar Scrapper: Sharp stuff (counts as hand weapons and throwing weapons), Rhinox:Tusks and horns (counts as a hand weapon), Special Rules: Armour Bane (2, Rhinox only), Close Order, Fear, First Charge, Impact Hits (D6+1), Large Target

unit.name: Stonehorn Riders
unit.description: Troop Type: Behemoth, Base Size: 100 x 150 mm, Unit Size: 1, Armour Value: 4+, Equipment: Stonehorn: Horns of stone (see below),, Ogre Beast Rider: Hand weapon and chaintrap (see below), Ogre Crew: Hand weapon and harpoon launcher (see page 26), Special Rules: Armour Bane (2, Stonehorn only), Close Order, First Charge, Howdah, Impact Hits (D6+1), Large Target, Stone Skeleton, Swiftstride, Terror, Thunderous Charge

unit.name: Thundertusk Riders
unit.description: Troop Type: Behemoth, Base Size: 100 x 150 mm, Unit Size: 1, Armour Value: 5+, Equipment: Thundertusk: Great tusks (see below) and chill breath (see below), Ogre Beast Rider: Hand weapon and chaintrap (see below), Ogre Crew: Hand weapon and harpoon launcher (see page 26), Special Rules: Close Order, First Charge, Howdah, Impact Hits (D3), Large Target, Numbing Chill, Stomp Attacks (3), Swiftstride, Terror

unit.name: Giants
unit.description: Troop Type: Behemoth, Base Size: 50 x 50 mm (min), 50 x 75 mm (max), Unit Size: 1, Equipment: Giants club (see page 18) and calloused hide (counts as light armour) Special Rules: Close Order, Giant Attacks, Immune to Psychology, Large Target, Pick Up And, Stomp Attacks (D6), Terror, Timmm-berrr!, Unbreakable

unit.name: Gorgers
unit.description: Troop Type: Monstrous creature, Base Size: 50 x 50 mm, Unit Size: 1, Equipment: Wicked claws (see below), distensible jaw (see below) and calloused hide (counts as light armour), Special Rules: Ambushers, Close Order, Fear, Frenzy, Ravenous Hunger, Regeneration (6+), Swiftstride, Unbreakable

mount.name: Stonehorn
mount.description: Troop Type: Behemoth, Base Size: 100 x 150 mm, Unit Size: 1, Equipment: Horns of stone (see below) and petrified flesh (counts as full plate armour), Special Rules: Armour Bane (2, Stonehorn only), Close Order, First Charge, Impact Hits (D6+1), Large Target, Stone Skeleton, Swiftstride, Terror, Thunderous Charge

mount.name: Thundertusk
mount.description: Troop Type: Behemoth, Base Size: 100 x 150 mm, Unit Size: 1, Equipment: Great tusks (see below), chill breath (see below) and frozen pelt (counts as heavy armour), Special Rules: Close Order, First Charge, Impact Hits (D3), Large Target, Numbing Chill, Stomp Attacks (3), Swiftstride, Terror

item.name: Mawseeker
item.description: Models whose troop type is infantry only. This character has a +1 modifier to their Toughness characteristic. However, this character is also subject to the Stupidity special rule.

item.name: Mountaineater
item.description: Models whose troop type is infantry only. This character cannot be wounded by a roll To Wound of 2, regardless of the Strength of the attack.

item.name: Giantbreaker
item.description: This character (but not their mount) has a +1 modifier to their Strength characteristic. However, this character cannot refuse a challenge and neither they, nor any unit they have joined, can Flee as a charge reaction.

item.name: Kineater
item.description: Army General only. Unless this character is fleeing, friendly models within this characters Command range may re-roll any failed Panic or Rally test.

item.name: Longstrider
item.description: Models whose troop type is infantry only. This character has a +1 modifier to their Movement characteristic.

item.name: Beastkiller
item.description: Once per turn, this character may re-roll a single failed roll To Wound made against an enemy model with the Large Target special rule.

item.name: Deathcheater
item.description: Once per game, you may make your opponent re-roll a single roll To Wound made against this character.

item.name: Thundermace
item.description:
R: Combat
S: S+2
AP: -2
Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Magical Attacks, Requires Two Hands, Strike Last

Notes: Rather than attacking normally, the wielder of the Thundermace may choose to make a special Thunderstrike attack. If they do, make a single roll To Hit. If this is successful, place a small (3") blast template so that its central hole is directly over the centre of the hit unit. Any enemy model whose base lies underneath the template risks being hit by this weapon.

item.name: Tenderiser
item.description:
R: Combat
S: S+2
AP: -3
Special Rules: Extra Attacks (+1), Magical Attacks, Multiple Wounds (D3), Strike Last

item.name: Skullplucker
item.description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -
Special Rules: Killing Blow, Magical Attacks, Strike First

item.name: Bloodcleaver
item.description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -1
Special Rules: Magical Attacks

Notes: Emissaries of the Great Maw only. If the wielder of the Bloodcleaver causes one or more unsaved wounds during the Combat phase, they recover a single lost Wound.

item.name: Gut Maw
item.description: The Gut Maw is a suit of heavy armour. In addition, for each unsaved wound the wearer causes during a Challenge, they recover a single lost Wound.

item.name: Mastodon Armour
item.description: The Mastodon Armour is a suit of full plate armour. In addition, its wearer has a 6+ Ward save against any wounds suffered.

item.name: Spangleshard
item.description: The Spangleshard gives its bearer a 4+ Ward save against any wounds suffered. However, if a natural 1 is rolled, the Spangleshard is destroyed and it cannot be used again.

item.name: Cathayan Jet Pendant
item.description: A Cathayan Jet Pendant gives its bearer a 6+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by a Magic Missile, a Magical Vortex, or an Assailment spell.

item.name: Dragonhide Banner
item.description: A unit carrying the Dragonhide Banner may re-roll any rolls To Hit of a natural 1. In addition, a unit carrying the Dragonhide Banner has the Flaming Attacks special rule.

item.name: Rune Maw
item.description: When an enemy Wizard chooses a unit carrying the Rune Maw as the target of a spell, roll a D6. On a 3+, the Wizards controlling player must choose another target. If there is no other viable target in range, the spell cannot be cast.

item.name: Cannibal Totem
item.description: A unit carrying the Cannibal Totem gains the Regeneration (5+) special rule, but rolls only a single D6 when making a Pursuit roll (rather than the usual 2D6).

item.name: Bull Standard
item.description: A unit carrying the Bull Standard may re-roll any failed rolls To Wound when resolving Impact Hits.

item.name: Jade Lion
item.description: The bearer of the Jade Lion and their unit may re-roll any failed Fear, Panic, Rally or Terror test.

item.name: Daemon-Slayer Scars
item.description: The bearer of Daemon-slayer Scars gains the Terror special rule.

item.name: Fistful Of Laurels
item.description: Single use. The bearer of a Fistful of Laurels and their unit may re-roll the 2D6 when making a Break test.

item.name: Halfling Cookbook
item.description: The bearer of the Halfling Cookbook increases their Command range, Dispel range and the range of a single spell chosen by their controlling player (not including range self spells) by 3".

item.name: Hellheart
item.description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, the bearer of the Hellheart may consume it. When they do so, they immediately lose a single Wound. However, until your next Start of Turn sub-phase, if any enemy Wizard rolls any natural double when making a Casting roll, the spell is miscast.

item.name: Gruts Sickle
item.description:
After making a Casting roll, the bearer of Gruts Sickle may use it to roll an additional D3 and add its result to their Casting roll. However, a single friendly model within 3" of the bearer immediately loses a single Wound.

Note that the result of this additional D3 cannot cause a miscast or a perfect invocation.

item.name: Largely Insignificant
item.description: Units with this special rule never cause friendly units to make Panic tests. However, a unit with this special rule cannot be joined by a character without this special rule.

item.name: Look-Out Gnoblar
Look-out Gnoblar
item.description: A champion or character that has joined a unit with this special rule may make a Look Out, Sir!" roll if there are two or more rank and file models in the unit (rather than the usual five). In addition, you may re-roll a Look Out, Sir!" roll if there are five or more rank and file models in the unit.

item.name: Mournfang Charge
item.description: Impact Hits caused by a model with this special rule have the Armour Bane (1) special rule and an Armour Piercing characteristic of -1.

item.name: Numbing Chill
item.description: Whilst in base contact with this model, enemy models suffer a -1 modifier to their Weapon Skill and Initiative characteristics, to a minimum of 1.

item.name: Ogre Charge
item.description: The Armour Piercing characteristic of any Impact Hits caused by a model with this special rule (but not its mount) is improved by the current Rank Bonus of its unit (or, in the case of characters, the current Rank Bonus of any unit they have joined).

item.name: Stone Skeleton
item.description: This model is less vulnerable to the Multiple Wounds (X) special rule. If it suffers an unsaved wound from an attack with this special rule, reduce the number of Wounds lost by 1, to a minimum of 1.

item.name: Thunderous Charge
item.description: Impact Hits caused by this model have an Armour Piercing characteristic of -2.

item.name: Great Maw
Lore Of The Great Maw
item.description:
A Wizard with the Lore of the Great Maw special rule may discard one of their randomly generated spells as normal. When they do so, they may select instead either the signature spell of their chosen Lore of Magic, or one of the spells listed below.

Toothcracker
Type: Enchantment
Casting Value: 7+/10+
Range: 12"
Effect: If this spell is cast with a casting result of 7 or more, the target friendly unit gains a +1 modifier to its Toughness characteristic (to a maximum of 10). If this spell is cast with a casting result of 10 or more, the target friendly unit gains a +2 modifier to its Toughness characteristic (to a maximum of 10). This spell lasts until the end of this turn.


Trollguts
Type: Enchantment
Casting Value: 8+/11+
Range: 15"
Effect: If this spell is cast with a casting result of 8 or more, the target friendly unit gains the Regeneration (6+) special rule. If this spell is cast with a casting result of 11 or more, the target friendly unit gains the Regeneration (5+) special rule. This spell lasts until your next Start of Turn sub-phase.

item.name: Harpoon Launcher
item.description:
R: 36"
S: 6
AP: -2
Special Rules: Multiple Wounds (D3), Ponderous

item.name: Ironfist
Ironfists
item.description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -
Special Rules: Extra Attacks (1), Requires Two Hands

Notes: An Ironfist is an additional hand weapon (as described on page 213 of the Warhammer: the Old World rulebook. In addition, a model equipped with an Ironfist improves its armour value by 1. An Ironfist cannot be used alongside a magic weapon to gain an extra attack, or to improve the wielders armour value.

item.name: Ogre Pistol
Ogre pistol
item.description:
R: 24"
S: 4
AP: -1
Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Quick Shot

item.name: Brace Of Ogre Pistols
Brace of Ogre pistols
item.description:
Ranged:
R: 24"
S: 4
AP: -1
Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Multiple Shots (2), Quick Shot

Combat:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -
Special Rules: Extra Attacks (1), Requires Two Hands

Notes: A brace of Ogre pistols has two profiles, representing how the weapons are used in combat.

item.name: Horns of stone
item.description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -2
Special Rules: -

item.name: Great tusks
item.description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -1
Special Rules: Armour Bane (2)

item.name: Chill breath
item.description:
R: N/A
S: 2
AP: -1
Special Rules: Breath Weapon, Multiple Wounds (D3)

item.name: Bull Charge
item.description: Impact Hits caused by this model (but not its mount) have an Armour Piercing characteristic of -1.

item.name: Butchers Cauldron
item.description: This character replaces the Impact Hits (2) special rule with the Impact Hits (D3+1) special rule. In addition, during the Command sub-phase of their turn, if they are not engaged in combat, a character with a Butchers Cauldron may attempt to make an offering to the Great Maw by making a Leadership test (using their own Leadership). If this test is passed, until your next Start of Turn sub-phase this character and any unit they have joined gains the Regeneration (5+) special rule. However, if this test is failed, this character immediately loses a single Wound.

item.name: Be a Level 4 Wizard
item.description: Upgrade wizard to level 4.

item.name: Be a Level 2 Wizard
item.description: Upgrade wizard to level 2.

item.name: Running With The Pack
item.description: A Hunter that joins a unit of Sabretusks gains the Swiftstride special rule for as long as they remain with the unit. In addition, for as long as the Hunter remains with the unit, the Sabretusks lose the Impetuous special rule.

item.name: great throwing spears
Great throwing spears
item.description:
R: 12"
S: S+1
AP: -1
Special Rules: Move & Shoot, Quick Shot

item.name: Blessings Of The Volcano God
item.description:
A model with this special rule has a 4+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by an attack that has the Flaming Attacks special rule.

Flaming breath: R: N/A, S: 4, AP: -1, Special Rules: Breath Weapon, Flaming Attacks

item.name: Champion
Crusher
Gutlord
Thunderfist
Snarefinger
Maneater Captain
Groinbiter
Greyback
item.description: Counts as unit champion

item.name: Leadbelcher guns
Leadbelcher gun
leadbelcher guns
Leadbelcher Guns
item.description:
Solid shot
R: 24"
S: 5
AP: -2
Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Cumbersome, Multiple Wounds (2)

Scatter shot
R: 18"
S: 3
AP: -
Special Rules: Armour Bane (1)

Notes: A Leadbelcher gun has two profiles, representing its two modes of firing. If the roll To Hit is successful when firing scatter shot, a leadbelcher gun causes D3 hits to the target enemy unit, rather than the usual one.

item.name: Traps & Snares
item.description: Any enemy model that ends its charge move in base contact with a model with this special rule must make a Dangerous Terrain test.

item.name: Grimfrost weapons
Grimfrost weapon
item.description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -1
Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Magical Attacks

item.name: Monstrous tusks
item.description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -1
Special Rules: Armour Bane (1)

item.name: Cannon Of The Sky-Titans
Cannon of the Sky-titans
item.description:
Solid shot
R: 36"
S: 10
AP: -3
Special Rules: Armour Bane (2), Cannon Fire, Cumbersome, Multiple Wounds (D3+1)

Scatter shot
R: N/A
S: 4
AP: -1
Special Rules; Breath Weapon

Notes: A Cannon of the Sky-Titans has two profiles, representing its two modes of firing. When firing solid shot, this weapon shoots like a cannon, using the Cannon Fire special rule. This weapon uses the Ironblaster Misfire table.

Ironblaster Misfire Table (D6)
1: Kaboom! Constantly mistreated by the Ogres, the cannon explodes spectacularly. The model is destroyed and immediately removed from play.
2-3: Krrack! With a tremendous crack, the cannon splits along its length, rendering it useless. The model cannot shoot with this weapon for the remainder of the game.
4-6: Ack! Through its own ineptitude, the Gnoblar Scrapper has become stuck in the mechanism. The model does not shoot this turn and cannot shoot with this weapon during the next round.

item.name: Scraplauncher Catapult
Scraplauncher catapult
item.description:
R: 12-48"
S: 3 (4)
AP: -(-2)
Special Rules: Bombardment, Cumbersome, Multiple Wounds (2)

Notes: This weapon shoots like a stone thrower, using the Bombardment special rule, a 5" blast template and the Scraplauncher Misfire table. The Multiple Wounds (2) special rule applies only to a single model whose base lies underneath the central hole of the blast template.

Scraplauncher Catapult Misfire Table (D2)
1: Kerr-unch! The Scraplauncher comes apart in a shower of metal and wood. The model is destroyed and immediately removed from play.
2-3: Snap! With an ear-splitting crack, the arm of the catapult snaps cleanly in two. The model cannot shoot with this weapon for the remainder of the game.
4-6: Splang! The Scraplauncher sprays debris in all directions, but mainly straight up. The model does not shoot this turn and cannot shoot with this weapon during the next round.

item.name: Blood vulture
blood vulture
item.description:
R: 36"
S: 4
AP: -1
Special Rules: Ignores Cover, Move & Shoot, Quick Shot

item.name: Chaintrap
item.description:
R: 12"
S: S+1
AP: -
Special Rules: Killing Blow

item.name: Giant Attacks
item.description:
Instead of attacking normally during the Combat phase or making a Pick Up And attack, a Giant may choose to make a Giant Attack. To make a Giant Attack, nominate an enemy unit that the Giant is engaged in combat with to be the target of the attack and roll on the Giant Attacks table below to determine what the Giant does:

Giant Attacks Table (D6)
1 Eadbutt: The Giant singles out a lone enemy and eadbutts them. Nominate a single model in the fighting rank of an enemy unit the Giant is engaged with to be the target of this attack. That model is hit and suffers D3+1 wounds with no armour or Regeneration saves permitted (Ward saves can be attempted as normal).
2 Belly Flop: The Giant crashes down bodily upon the enemy. Place a small (3") blast template so that its central hole is directly over the centre of the target unit. Any model (friend or foe, but not including this model) whose base lies underneath the template risks being hit and suffering a single hit, using the Strength characteristic of this model, with an AP of -2.
3-4 Mighty Swing: The Giant swings its club through the enemy ranks. For this attack, the Giant is subject to the Random Attacks special rule and has an Attacks characteristic of D6+1, and the Giants club has a Strength characteristic of S+1 and an AP of -2. 5 Thump With Club: The Giant grasps its club two-handed and cracks its enemy on the head. Nominate a single model in the fighting rank of an enemy unit the Giant is engaged with to be the target of this attack. For this attack, the Giants club has a Strength characteristic of S+4, an AP of -4 and the Multiple Wounds (D6) special rule.
6 Jump Up & Down: The Giant jumps around, kicking and flattening the enemy. For this attack, the Giant does not use its club. Instead, the target unit suffers D6+1 hits, each using the Strength characteristic of this model, with no armour save permitted (Ward and Regeneration saves can be attempted as normal).

item.name: Pick Up And
item.description:
Instead of attacking normally during the Combat phase or making a Giant Attack, a Giant that is engaged in combat with one or more units whose troop type is regular infantry or heavy infantry may choose to make a Pick Up And attack. To make a Pick Up And attack, nominate an enemy unit of regular or heavy infantry that the Giant is engaged in combat with. The unit must immediately make an Initiative test:
- If this test is failed, a victim is picked up by the Giant. What happens next does not bear thinking about but, whatever it is, a single model belonging to the target unit is immediately removed from play as a casualty. - If this test is passed, the warriors manage to duck and dodge away from the Giants grasping hands. No one is picked up and the attack has no effect.

Next, roll a D6:
- On a roll of 1-3, the Giant forgets what it is doing and makes no further attacks. - On a roll of 4+, the Giant attempts to pick up another enemy. The target unit must make another Initiative test.
This continues until the Giant forgets what it is doing and stops making attacks, or until the target unit is destroyed.

Enemy models removed from play are considered to have been removed from the fighting rank of the enemy unit.

item.name: Giants club
item.description:
R: Combat
S:*
AP: *
Special Rules: -

Notes: A Giants club may have different characteristics and special rules depending upon what they do with it, as described in the Giant Attacks special rule.

item.name: Ravenous Hunger
item.description: When a Gorger declares a charge, it may re-roll its Charge roll.

item.name: Wicked claws
item.description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -2
Special Rules: -

item.name: Distensible jaw
item.description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -
Special Rules: Killing Blow

Note: In combat, this model must make one of its attacks each turn with this weapon.

item.name: Magical standard
item.description: Unit may purchase a magic standard
